footer.info: New in Lund is a website created by E-Sektionen within TLTH to help new students get an easier start in Lund. We collect information about everything from student life to practical things like finding an apartment.

titles.home: Welcome to Lund! | New in Lund, your guide to the student life in Lund and at LTH
titles.nollning: The nollning at LTH and the E-Guild | New in Lund
titles.about: About the programs | New in Lund

descriptions.main: Newly admitted and curious about what awaits you? Here you will find all the information you need to get a good start in Lund. We collect information about everything from student life to practical things like finding an apartment.

home.title: Welcome to the best student city in Sweden!
home.subtitle: We hope you choose to join us at the E-Guild

nollning.title: The nollning at the E-Guild
nollning.subtitle: The reset at the E section is to welcome all new students to Lund, LTH and the E section. As a Nolla, you can be very lost, you can, for example, lose yourself in the premises of the E-house, forget time, or maybe even take a dip in Sjön Sjøn. That is precisely why there are Phøs, Phaddrar and a whole guild with a heart of gold that is here to guide you through your first time as a student.

nollning.title: Looking for information about the nollning?

welcome.title: Hello and welcome to Lund!
welcome.content: Lund may feel like a small town, but with almost half of the population being students, there is always something to do. As a new student, you are greeted by a multitude of associations that deal with everything from spex, parties and various sports, all just a few minutes away by bike. Lund would not have been the city it is without the students and that is why it is considered Sweden's best student city.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: We have collected the most common questions we get below, if you can't find what you're looking for you can always
faq.not_found: Unable to find what you were looking for?

what.title: What is the nollning?
what.content: The reset is a mix of play, frolic, party and studying, which means there is something for everyone. What is certain is that it will give you precious memories for a lifetime. On the first day at LTH, you are divided into a mentor group and will be directly introduced to both newly admitted and old students. The phadders who have experience of life at LTH will help and support you and will be able to answer all kinds of questions. The phadder group will be a safe point throughout the nollning, but over time you will of course socialize with others at the reset as well!

differences.title: Differences from other universities
differences.content: If you have heard horror stories about various arrival activities for new students (nollning), it is important to know that the nollning at LTH is for you and for you to feel safe and welcome. The nollning is completely voluntary and the large mix of activities means that you can participate in what suits your interests. The most important thing is that EVERYONE who participates should feel that they become part of a guild's community, feel safe at LTH and make friends for life.

nations.title: Nations in Lund
nations.content: Nations are probably the most classic associations in Lund and what you often think of when Lund's student life is mentioned. In the old days, you joined the nation that represented the country or geographic region you came from, but nowadays all students can join any nation they want. Common to all nations is that all students are often welcome at the events organized, even if they are not members. However, members can receive certain benefits such as cheaper entry or standing in the nation's housing queue. So look around at the different nations below and see which one suits you best! If you are not satisfied with the nation you have joined, you can always change next term!

lundakarnevalen.title: Lundakarnevalen
lundakarnevalen.content: You can't talk about Lund without mentioning the Lund Carnival! As one of the world's largest events organized entirely by volunteering students, it is unique in its kind. Every fourth year, the students in Lund take a weekend across the park at the Cathedral, also known as Lundagård. Everything you can think of is arranged here: game tables, shows, circus, bars, restaurants and much more. The next carnival starts in 2026!

more_in_lund.title: More to do in Lund
more_in_lund.content: There are many things to do in Lund!

spex.title: Spex
spex.content: Spex may be the most classic Lund student experience out there. It can probably be best described as a theater piece with a strong focus on humor and song, often with references to student life and various events in the outside world. If you like being on stage, singing or playing instruments, this is perfect for you! But of course it also suits you who like to cook, work with technology, organize parties, sew, make-up or just have a lot of fun!

karer.title: Kårer
karer.content: The various programs at Lund University organize themselves in student associations called "kårer". Their main task is to monitor studies and provide the students with a social context. As a student at LTH, you will be a member of the Teknologkåren (TLTH), which is the umbrella organization for the various guilds, including the E-guild. Both TLTH and the guilds organize several events for their members, for example nollningen.

valborg.title: Last of April (Valborg)
valborg.content: Valborg in Lund is something completely unique. When the sun finally comes out again and everything is in full bloom, the whole city comes alive. One of Sweden's largest spontaneous parties takes place in the city park, the nations invite to concerts and parties and from every balcony happy shouts and noise are heard. A day (or several) that attracts both students and people from all over Scania.

e.title: Electrical Engineering
e.description: Electrical engineering is about developing the technology and society of the future in everything from medical equipment to self-driving vehicles, robots, 5G networks and renewable energy sources. After the education, there is a good job market where you have the opportunity to create sustainable solutions for today's and tomorrow's society.

bme.title: Biomedical Engineering
bme.description: The education in biomedical engineering at LTH is unique in Sweden and is for those with an interdisciplinary interest and who want to lay the foundation for the health of the future. Here we provide you with the knowledge that is in demand in both the medical technology industry and research as well as health care. The program is developed in collaboration with industry and therefore emphasizes design and innovation with patient safety as an important requirement. Several courses are given at the hospital so that you can gain useful insights into how medical devices are used in healthcare.
